translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with the Teaching on Sound
Vipassī, the Leader of the World,
Then, filled with joy and happiness,
to the best Buddha, the Tamed One,
I gave a bowl of salt and oil,
and for an eon I rejoiced in heaven.
For ninety-one eons,🔽the bowl I gave
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the bowl.
I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the elder Supuṭakapūjaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā supuṭakapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Supuṭakapūjakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā supuṭakapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽supuṭaka pūjaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The story of Elder Supuṭakapūjaka is the seventh.
